content.question: Two pairs of long, parallel wires are arranged to produce a conducting square, as shown. A uniform, constant magnetic field is directed into the page throughout the region. The top horizontal wire is moving toward the top of the page with speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> and the right vertical wire is moving to the right with speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> such that the side length increases at a constant rate, inducing an <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> in the square loop. At the instant shown, the side length is <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math> and the <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> induced in the loop is <math alttext="epsilon" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi></math>. What is the <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> induced in the loop when the sides of the square have length <math alttext="2 s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></math> ?

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
